member.name: T:Prime31.MetroAds.MetroAd
member.summary:
You must first download and install the Microsoft Advertising SDK: http://go.microsoft.com/?linkid=9815330 The plugin will attempt to configure your Visual Studio References for you. If it fails, you can configure them manually following this guide: http://go.microsoft.com/?linkid=9815330
Ad unit test modes can be found here: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/advertising-windows-test-mode-values(v=msads.10).aspx
All events fired include the adUnitId

member.name: M:Prime31.MetroAds.MetroAd.createAdControl(Prime31.MetroAds.MetroAdConfig)
member.summary: Creates an ad from the data provided in the adConfig object

member.name: M:Prime31.MetroAds.MetroAd.refresh
member.summary: Refreshes the ad as long as there is only one present

member.name: M:Prime31.MetroAds.MetroAd.refresh(System.String)
member.summary: Refreshes the ad with adUnitId

member.name: M:Prime31.MetroAds.MetroAd.removeAd
member.summary: Removes the ad as long as there is only one present

member.name: M:Prime31.MetroAds.MetroAd.removeAd(System.String)
member.summary: Removes the ad with adUnitId

member.summary: For testing you can use the applicationId "d25517cb-12d4-4699-8bdc-52040c712cab" and adUnitId "10043105" which is a 250 x 250 ad

member.summary: The applicationId for the ad. For testing "d25517cb-12d4-4699-8bdc-52040c712cab" can be used

member.summary: The adUnitId for the ad. For testing, see the available adUnitIds here: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/advertising-windows-test-mode-values(v=msads.10).aspx

member.summary: Ad width. This MUST MATCH EXACTLY THE WIDTH OF THE ADUNITID!

member.summary: Ad height. This MUST MATCH EXACTLY THE HEIGHT OF THE ADUNITID!
